info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 12:40PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 1240 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Prescott Regional Airport, or 6 miles northwest of Prescott Valley, moving northeast at 5 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Chino Valley, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Prescott Regional Airport, Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, Willow Creek Reservoir, Watson Lake and Williamson Valley.
This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 316 and 327. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 324.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Watson Lake Park.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM IMPACTING YAVAPAI COUNTY NEAR LOVE FIELD AIRPORT UNTIL 115 PM MST

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
